to open/to start/to initiate/to enlighten or awaken/to state/to inform

sentences.english: Xuguanqi was an outstanding agricultural scientist in late Ming Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 徐光启是我国明代晚期杰出的农业科学家。

definition: Matteo Ricci (1552-1610), Jesuit missionary and translator in Ming China
Matteo Ricci (1552-1610), Jesuit missionary and translator in Ming China/erroneous spelling of 利瑪竇|利玛窦
Huang Zongxi (1610-1695), scholar and writer of the Ming-Qing transition
Gu Yanwu (1613-1682), late Ming and early Qing Confucian philosopher, linguist and historian, played a founding role in phonology of early Chinese, author of Rizhilu or Record of daily study 日知錄|日知录
Zhang Pu (1602-1641), Ming dynasty scholar and prolific writer, proponent of 複社|复社[fu4 she4] cultural renewal movement, author of Five tombstone inscriptions 五人墓碑記|五人墓碑记[wu3 ren2 mu4 bei1 ji4]
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
a Jesuit/member of Society of Jesus
Xue Fucheng (1838-1894), Qing official and progressive political theorist
Xu Jiyu (1795-1873), Chinese geographer
Li Zhi (1527-1602), late Ming philosopher, historian and writer
Shen Baozhen (1820-1879), Qing Minister of the Navy, founded Fuzhou Naval College 船政學堂|船政学堂[Chuan2 zheng4 Xue2 tang2] in 1866
Yan Fu (1853-1921), influential Chinese writer and translator of Western books, esp. on social sciences
Lazzaro Cattaneo (1560-1640), Italian Jesuit missionary in China
reign name of Ming emperor (1573-1619)
William A.P. Martin (1827-1916), American missionary who lived 62 years in China between 1850 and 1916, and helped found many Chinese colleges, first president of Peking University
Qi Jiguang (1528-1588), military leader
